block.p: FISHER COMMUNICATIONS, Seattle, the operator of 12 television stations, said it would sell most of its real estate to focus on broadcasting and media and to cut business expenses in 2002.
GENENCOR INTERNATIONAL, Palo Alto, Calif., a maker of enzymes, said it had won its largest contract to date, a five-year agreement for as much as $600 million with Procter & Gamble.
FISHER COMMUNICATIONS, Seattle, the operator of 12 television stations, said it would sell most of its real estate to focus on broadcasting and media and to cut business expenses in 2002.
GENENCOR INTERNATIONAL, Palo Alto, Calif., a maker of enzymes, said it had won its largest contract to date, a five-year agreement for as much as $600 million with Procter & Gamble.

AEP INDUSTRIES, South Hackensack, N.J., said it had bought the New Zealand and Australian packaging units of Visy Industries, Melbourne, Australia, and would operate them in a joint venture with DS Smith of London.
BAUSCH & LOMB, Rochester, said it had bought an ophthalmic drugs business from Fidia Farmaceutici of Italy.
